A big concern from the event:  why no scientists or public health officials at the podium?  There continues to be very little opportunity for the press/public to interact with public health leaders in the middle of a pandemic.11/x
What would have been useful for the president to say more clearly is what the Administration is going to do differently now to get this pandemic crisis under control. What is going to change now. 7/x

Important to hear president offer direct statement that the pandemic is likely to get worse before it's going to get better. This is very different from inaccurate statements made by White House in last couple weeks that things were going very well in the US response.6/x

The president spoke this afternoon about the US response to the coronavirus pandemic.  There were a number of welcome public health-grounded messages.  But there are places where he needed to go further, or to clarify or ask more from governors.1/x

Such COVID disparity within same city: “In Houston neighborhood of Gulfton, more than 45,000 restaurant workers and housekeepers, immigrants and refugees live close together...At least 965 have been infected...far more per capita than city as a whole.” https://t.co/cVBpxYgF1a

“Six months after the coronavirus appeared in America, the nation has failed spectacularly to contain it. The country’s ineffective response has shocked observers around the planet. Many countries have rigorously driven infection rates nearly to zero. “ https://t.co/uvJhS6lSBH

How Sweden is on wrong track for Covid (things in common w/ erratic communications of  leaders in US:) “importance of testing has been played down for a long time ..still refuses to recommend masks in public, despite overwhelming evidence of effectiveness” https://t.co/Fn1ZWg5t0u

Church leaders that invite churchgoers back inside an indoor church when there is ongoing substantial community transmission of COVID are increasing the risk of those people getting COVID. Churchmembers should understand the risks from their health depts before they attend https://t.co/8MUNKf068Y

This report should be public. People should know what actions the White House coronavirus task force is recommending for states doing most poorly in COVID.  Governors need to explain to their people why they aren't following them. https://t.co/ce9Jvpvst2

Harrowing, moving account of impact of COVID on the Navajo, & how it took advantage of generations of government-led injustices against its people. This terrible experience w/ COVID should spur the US to change the way it treats its indigenous populations 
https://t.co/NbkrVz0y7I

Vietnam, country of 95M that has border w/ China, has 0 COVID deaths, avg of <10 cases/day. How? stay at home orders at start, extensive testing+contact tracing, clear communication, strict mask use. Has allowed them to reopen. Great report by @Ep1Chrissy  https://t.co/HKm5JV4iJK

No he really doesn't make a lot of mistakes.  He bases his views on COVID on science.  As new science emerges, he may change his views, as he should.  Undercutting one of the top federal scientists on COVID is a sad road to a worsening COVID crisis.  https://t.co/ELrONfRuyG

West VA would be far better off w/ Dr. Slemp still leading COVID pub health response. Article gives glimpse of the changes she was trying to bring to public health there. Not referenced here-the very positive metrics around her leadership of COVID there   https://t.co/n3IRbBNnIF

Also unclear answers given when reporters asked what schools should do if there is substantial community transmission of COVID occurring within a school district.6/x

At White House Coronavirus task force meeting today, they described how each governor is given detailed data on regular basis about it's COVID numbers, statistics etc.  That data should be made available to public so they can understand their own risks.1/x https://t.co/3IkrLwczJU

"She blamed the latest wave in large part on Israel's swift reopening of schools in May and wedding venues in June.
Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu had declared victory over the pandemic in May and encouraged Israelis to go out and 'enjoy yourselves.' " https://t.co/83Coj9xv1O

There have been some schools opened in other parts of world which have had minimal or no reported outbreaks, which is reassuring (though some of those schools are operating in very low COVID prevalence settings – the opposite of situation in many places in the US right now.)6/x
Various models have concluded the opposite – some say that schools will accelerate COVID outbreaks, others conclude they won’t. 5/x

Children are at far lower risk of serious illness than adults in terms of COVID19.  But we still don’t have enough evidence about how frequently children spread COVID to other children. Or how frequently children spread the disease to adults in school or adults in their homes.3/x

Schools are extraordinarily important and we should work to open them safely in the fall.  But mtg today had no one expressing concerns of so many parents+teachers. And no one talking about what is known /not known about the science related to schools and COVID spread.2/x
